prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating the First Rectangular Prism Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Set up a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0024, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. a. Create a rectangle (face_1) with the following four lines (loop_1): i. line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.7476, 0.0] ii. line_2: [0.7476, 0.0] to [0.7476, 0.0312] iii. line_3: [0.7476, 0.0312] to [0.0, 0.0312] iv. line_4: [0.0, 0.0312] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.7476. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by defining a normal vector equivalent to the Z-axis of the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.0312 units in the normal direction. Part 2: Creating the Second Rectangular Prism 1. Set up a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.657, 0.0]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. a. Create a rectangle (face_1) with the following four lines (loop_1): i. line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.7476, 0.0] ii. line_2: [0.7476, 0.0] to [0.7476, 0.0312] iii. line_3: [0.7476, 0.0312] to [0.0, 0.0312] iv. line_4: [0.0, 0.0312] to [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.7476. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D by defining a normal vector equivalent to the Z-axis of the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.0312 units in the normal direction. The resulting CAD model should consist of two rectangular prisms stacked vertically, aligned horizontally in the center, and slightly tilted to the right.</description>
